newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Jakarta call money traded at 12.0/13.0 percent.
newsitem.headline: Jakarta call money traded at 12.0/13.0 percent.

text.p: Jakarta call money was traded at 12.0/13.0 percent on Wednesday morning on the back of a relatively well balanced liquidity supply, dealers said.
One local bank dealer said demand and supply seemed to be well balanced amid a neutral central bank money policy. But a slight increase in rupiah demand was see mid-morning, he said.
Another dealer said he expected conditions to remain the same on Thursday but he would be cautious on Friday because of a possible repeat of last week's tight liquidity.
But the local bank dealer said the expected fresh transfer funds from the government into state banks for civil servants' salaries may help fuel overall market demand for liquidity.
Short-dated swap rates remained stable which may indicate anticipation of stable liquidity.
Overnight swap was last at 0.45/0.55, slightly lower from the opening level of 0.5/0.6. Tom/next was at 0.50/0.53 against the opening of 0.53/0.57 points.
The average overnight interbank rate on Tuesday was 12.75 percent, compared with 16.47 percent on Monday.
